pages.settings.section.title: Google Drive Uploads
pages.settings.section.subtitle: Configuration
pages.settings.header.title: Google Drive Configuration
pages.settings.header.description: Configure the credentials of the Google Drive provider for your uploads
pages.settings.credentials.title: Google OAuth2 Credentials
You need to create a google cloud project first
Create OAuth 2.0 Client IDs using the redirect URI below
pages.settings.credentials.redirectUri.l: Redirect URI to add to your project's OAuth credentials
pages.settings.credentials.redirectUri.h: You will have to add one redirect URI per environment/domain (dev, prod, ...)
pages.settings.credentials.clientId.hint: You can also add it to your "config/plugin.js" as "upload.config.providerOptions.clientId" entry
You can also add it to your "config/plugin.js" as "upload.config.providerOptions.clientId" entry
pages.settings.credentials.token.generat: The current token has been generated on
pages.settings.targetFolder.title: Google Drive Target Folder
pages.settings.targetFolder.description: Define the Google Drive folder in which you want to store your uploads
pages.settings.targetFolder.pattern.hint: The variables listed below can be inserted using the following syntax:
Type "/" to store your uploads at the root of your drive
pages.settings.targetFolder.result.label: Target Folder Result
The folder will be created on your drive during the next upload.
Changing the folder will not break your existing uploads. You can move them manually, if you want, in Drive with no fear.
pages.settings.dump.title: Fetched Settings
pages.settings.dump.notInProduction: NB: This section will be automatically hidden in production environment
